pageContext.claim: “I'm 94 percent in the Republican Party approval rating.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump was at 90 percent approval from Republicans in a Gallup poll from June 2018, not 94 percent. It was not a record, as other presidents have polled higher among GOP respondents. A Reuters poll found that Trump's support among Republicans increased after he made racist comments telling four Democratic congresswomen of color to "go back" to their home countries. (All four are U.S. citizens, and three were born in the United States.)
